蝘字的基本解释

蝘
yǎn
〔蝘蜓〕a.古书上指壁虎。b.一种爬虫，全身有光滑圆鳞，背面古铜色，有金属光泽，捕食昆虫。亦称“铜石龙子”。
蝉的一种。

蝘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yǎn］
［《廣韻》於幰切，上阮，影。］
［《廣韻》於殄切，上銑，影。］
亦作“1”。
(1)蝉属。
(2)守宫。俗称壁虎。
(3)同“鼹”。参见“蝘鼠”、“蝘腹”。

蝘字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蝘； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1089第14
【唐韻】【集韻】?於殄切，音偃。【詩·大雅】如蜩如螗。【傳】螗，蝘也。【疏】蟬屬也。草木疏云：一名蛁蟟，靑徐謂之螇螰，楚人謂之蟪蛄，秦燕謂之蛥蚗，或名之蜓蚞。郭云：俗呼爲胡蟬，江南謂之螗蛦，互詳蜩、蟬二字註。　又蝘蜓。【爾雅·釋魚】蜥蜴，蝘蜓。【揚雄·解嘲】執蝘蜓而嘲龜龍，不亦病乎。【註】說文曰：在壁曰蝘蜓，在草曰蜥蜴。【古今注】蝘蜓一名龍子，一曰守宮，一曰蛇醫，大者長三尺，其色黑紺者善螫人。一名黑螈，一名綠螈也。【廣韻】《博物志》：蝘蜓卽守宮，以器養之，食以朱砂，體盡赤，重七斤，擣萬杵，以㸃女人體，終身不滅。淫則㸃滅，故號守宮。漢武試之，驗。互見蜥字註。　又【集韻】隱幰切，音匽。義同。　或作?。

考證：〔【爾雅·釋蟲】蜥蜴，蝘蜓。〕　謹照原書釋蟲改釋魚。

Worm
Basic explanation of words
Worm
yǎn
〔蝘fly〕 a. The ancient book refers to the gecko. b. A kind of reptile with smooth round scales on the whole body, bronze-colored back, metallic luster, and prey on insects. Also known as "Copper Stone Dragon".
A kind of cicada.
Worm
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yǎn］
["Guang Yun" Yu Jiaqie, Shang Ruan, Ying. ]
["Guangyun" is cut, milled, and shadowed. ]
Also known as "1".
(1) Cicada genus.
(2) Gecko. Commonly known as gecko.
(3) Same as "Mole". See "Mouse", "Smoke Abdomen".

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　蝘; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 1089 14
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Yu Chen cut, sound Yan. 【Poetry·Daya】Like a scorpion. [Biography] 螗，蝘也. 【Sparse】Cicada is also a genus. Grass and trees and clouds: A scorpion worm, Qian Xu called the worm, the Chu people called the worm, and Qin Yan called the worm, or the famous worm. Guo Yun: It is commonly called Hu Cicada, and Jiangnan is called "Cicada". The two characters of "Cicada" and "Cicada" are explained in detail.　Flies again. 【Erya·Shiyu】Lizards, trophies. [Yang Xiong·Quiet] It is not also sick to hold the dragonfly and laugh at the tortoise and dragon. [Note] Speaking of text: In the wall, it is called a worm, and in the grass it is called a lizard. [Ancient and Modern Note] The dragonfly is a dragon, one is a guardian, the other is a snake doctor, the older one is three feet long, and the black cyanotic one is good at stinging people. One black newt, one green newt. [Guang Yun] "Natural History": The insects keep the palace, raise them with utensils, eat cinnabar, body red, weigh seven catties, smash ten thousand pestles, and use a woman's body, which will be immortal for life. Fornication is extinguished, so the name is Shougong. Hanwu test, test. See each other's note on the word lizard.　[Jiyun] Hiddenly cut, sound is stunned. The same meaning.　Or make?.
